titleStmt.title: J. W. McIntosh and F. M. McIntosh to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6691

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Governer of the Commonweth of Kentucky Sir A petishion that I sent to you asking your favor I understand that the Rebble party have Goten up A petishion against Sir I can say to you that thar is not one union man that has assind his paper this is anuf to prove that tha one prosicuting me thru Rebble predjudice also I can say that thar is no union man hier that have dun more to Suprress Gurillers than I hav this the Cause of thar predjudice against me Gov Bramlette I am a pore man and hard Run
and ned my money to suport my famley on Consquenly I humbley Beg that the Sentents past on me By that party may B Remited I am purfectly willing to abide By the laws of my Country But this is positiveley Rongfulley Goten up against me By that party

this July the 25th 1865
Trigg County Ky
Your with Respect
J. W. McIntosh
F. M. McIntosh
